intro: Mastixia kaniensis, commonly known as the Kaniensis mastix, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Mastixia kaniensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
